result.execSummary:
The defendant Kedrick Dl Hawthorne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kedrick Dl Hawthorne

defendant.name: Hawthorne, Kedrick Dl
defendant.address: 660 Circle Pine Drive #201, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing for Unpaid Court Obligations. Extended 1 year or until all obligations are completed.
Probation review hearing on February 2, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction.  Not Deliverable as addressed.

12:07 Defendant Kedrick Dl Hawthorne in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan: files amended information. Def will plea guilty to amended Ct#1 in amended information. 1 year probation. Nelson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to amended Ct#1; Nelson stipulates to factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended Ct#1. OSullivan and Nelson argue sentencing. Court: S/W 1 year on each count; concurrent. conditions: any imposed by agent,  court costs and DNA surcharge.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Court reviews charge and penalties with defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information.  Court reads information to defendant.    Defendant enters not guilty plea to Count 1 at preliminary hearing.    Not guilty plea received by the court.    Pretrial Conference to be set.  The bond will continue as ordered.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.  Nelson addresses no contact provision.  Requests bond be modified to no abusive contact with Mr. Perry.  O'Sullivan objects to modification of no contact provision.  Court will allow provision to be "No Abusive Contact" for family birthday party on October 23, 2015.  No contact provision to remain in effect at all other times.

4:46 p.m.  Defendant Kedrick Dl Hawthorne in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   O'Sullivan withdraws previous request for warrant.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.     Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

3:16 p.m.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan requests bench warrant on defendant's failure to appear.  Nelson agrees.  Court grants request for warrant and will sign upon presentation.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 4:01  Defendant Kedrick Dl Hawthorne in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Kedrick Dl Hawthorne in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint   Charges read to the defendant.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
